intro: Cryptantha fulvocanescens var. echinoides, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its stems are often branched and covered in fine, glandular hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
